title: dig4gold
author: dig4gold
content: I need help with my account. My address is nw2thenines@gmail.com. To start off, I have personal information in two almost identical books.I used the wrong book, couldn't log in because of that error. I tried resetting for my password, multiple times and that didn't work to help me get access to my account. I am asking for assistance to get back into my account. I even tried using my old password but since I tried resetting password a couple times, the password I was using wouldn't work. So I'm locked out of my account mostly because I used the wrong book to find my password and the information wasn't there. Do you have any suggestions or could you help me get back into my account with the password I started out with?Please help! I hope you understand my situation. I just want to get back in with my original password.Thank youfor your assistance.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: dig4gold on September 20, 2022, 05:28:53 PMI need help with my account.What account? Bitcointalk? A web wallet? An exchange?QuoteI have personal information in two almost identical books.Do you mean physical books (with paper pages), or is this a wrong translation?QuoteI hope you understand my situation.Not really

comments.author: Xal0lex
comments.body: I think it's more likely that he's referring to his Bitcointalk account after all. And also, I think he means the notebooks, which are very similar and that he mixed them up. And trying to restore the password with the password recovery function, he banned himself.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: Follow this sticky: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5089777.0I'm assuming by the way you're talking that you've locked yourself out of your account like above. So, follow the top message on that thread, and that should be able to get you in as long as you try to include as much information as possible to how it happened. I'm also assuming there's a language barrier, and that's why the confusion. I'm assuming since this is in Meta, that it's indeed a Bitcointalk, and it would somewhat make sense with it being locked in that case. Are you provided with a email address by any chance when you hit the error? If not, you'll have to email the recovery email in that thread I've linked.

comments.author: imamusma
comments.body: Quote from: dig4gold on September 20, 2022, 05:28:53 PM I need help with my account. My address is nw2thenines@gmail.com. To start off, I have personal information in two almost identical books.I used the wrong book, couldn't log in because of that error. I tried resetting for my password, multiple times and that didn't work to help me get access to my account. I am asking for assistance to get back into my account. I even tried using my old password but since I tried resetting password a couple times, the password I was using wouldn't work. So I'm locked out of my account mostly because I used the wrong book to find my password and the information wasn't there. Do you have any suggestions or could you help me get back into my account with the password I started out with?Please help! I hope you understand my situation. I just want to get back in with my original password.Thank youfor your assistance.If you can tell us a little more information about what account you're talking about, then I'm sure you'll get the answer right from the start. But if you see this, tell me what account you want to recover.I don't want to guess, but it looks like the account you're referring to is a bitcointalk account. Try resetting your password via email and clicking the link sent to your email to set a new password. But you can only do that if you use an active email in your forum account. But first, complete your information when asking for help so as not to cause confusion.Can someone of you tell me why the search feature via email to find members in this forum is disabled?

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Quote from: imamusma on September 20, 2022, 08:09:12 PMCan someone of you tell me why the search feature via email to find members in this forum is disabled?For security reasons: Users' Bitcointalk email is even hidden by default upon registration, so you can't even know a user's email address except they tell you or make it known, which is not advisable. An email address should be 'secret', except it is a throw-away email address, and any email address used to register on this forum isn't a throw-away email, users' can either reset their passwords through it, and on the other hand, can be hacked through it if compromised, thus the forum shouldn't have any reason to enable search via email, so users' do not naively give out their email address for any reason, except to the forum administration.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: imamusma on September 20, 2022, 08:09:12 PMCan someone of you tell me why the search feature via email to find members in this forum is disabled?Privacy is to topmost reason I can think up.Emails are designed to be private, except the user choses to reveal them, so by that, other users should not be able to search up forum members using email addresses. This could lead to users randomly running through public emails, to know if it has a match on the forum.

comments.author: ShowOff
comments.body: Quote from: imamusma on September 20, 2022, 08:09:12 PMCan someone of you tell me why the search feature via email to find members in this forum is disabled?There are several features that are disabled for various reasons, including features to display all usernames in forum and search by email address. I agree that many people care deeply about privacy and security. Email is a contact one of your contacts where someone might take advantage of some of your vulnerabilities to hack and test how well you secure yourself via email. I know some users might display an email in their account but I'm sure it's not an active email so they shouldn't be afraid of phishing attempts or anything like that. So it's appropriate that email should be hidden by default in every forum account, unless the user displays it.
